Class DoubleNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • DoubleNode

  • public class DoubleNode
extends java.lang.Object
    This class hold 2 DoubleNode type pointers for a Node's previous and next node, and 1 char type parameter for holding the value of this new node.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleNode()
      default constructor
      DoubleNode(DoubleNode p, char i, DoubleNode n) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getC()
      Return the value of the current node; Precondition: The current node should exist.
      DoubleNode getNext()
      Return the previous node for the current node.
      DoubleNode getPrev()
      return the previous node for the current node.
      void setC(char c)
      Set the value of the current node.
      void setNext(DoubleNode n)
      Set a pointer to the previous node for the next node.
      void setPrev(DoubleNode p)
      Set a pointer to the previous node for the current node.

        default constructor

      • DoubleNode

        public DoubleNode(DoubleNode p,
          char i,
          DoubleNode n)
        Parameters:
        p - n DoubleNode type parameters
        i - char type parameter Initialize parameters by taking previous/next nodes and content to build up a new node

    • Method Detail

      • getPrev

        public DoubleNode getPrev()
        return the previous node for the current node. Precondition: The previous node should exist. Postcondition: If the previous is not present, null value would be returned; Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)

      • setPrev

        public void setPrev(DoubleNode p)
        Set a pointer to the previous node for the current node. Precondition: A Node should be given when this method is called. Postcondition:if the next node is not present, a pointer to null value would be defaulted. Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)

      • getNext

        public DoubleNode getNext()
        Return the previous node for the current node. Precondition: The next node should be present. Postcondition: If the next is not present, null value would be returned. Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)

      • setNext

        public void setNext(DoubleNode n)
        Set a pointer to the previous node for the next node. Precondition: A DoubleNode should be given when this method is called. Postcondition: If the next is not present, a pointer to null would be defaulted Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)

      • getC

        public char getC()
        Return the value of the current node; Precondition: The current node should exist. Postcondition: if the value of current node wasn't given at the time the node created, a char containing ' ' would be return. Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)

      • setC

        public void setC(char c)
        Set the value of the current node. Precondition: A char type variable should be given when this method is called and the node is present for setting the value. Postcondition: A char type value will be returned. Best Case:Big theta(1) Worst Case: Big theta(1)
